column2: PA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Pennsylvania
column6: PA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Work zone ahead
column6: Road ends ahead

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Side road
column6: No U-Turn

column2: 3. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column6: Drive with caution.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column10: Be prepared to stop for the red light.

column2: 4. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column10: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 5. To reduce the risk of being involved in a crash, drivers should:
column4: drive on side streets and back roads whenever possible.
column6: avoid driving during rush hour.
column8: communicate with other drivers on the road.
column10: ignore other drivers on the road.

column2: 6. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column6: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 7. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column6: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column8: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column10: stare straight ahead at all times.

column2: 8. When driving on wet roads, you should:
column4: stay close to the vehicle ahead.
column6: increase following distance to 5 or 6 seconds.

column2: 9. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Pennant
column6: Diamond

column2: 10. Before changing lanes on a multi-lane highway, drivers should:
column4: check their mirrors and blind spots.
column6: reduce their speed.

column2: 11. Before passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to alert the other driver.
column6: sound your horn to get the drivers attention.
column10: put on your headlightsÂ to warn the other driver.

column2: 12. Alcohol:
column4: decreases your driving errors.
column6: has a negative effect on your reaction time.
column10: begins to metabolize itself more quickly.

column2: 13. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Triangle
column6: Diamond

column2: 14. This warning sign:
column4: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column6: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 15. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column6: Listen to heavy metal music.
column8: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.

column2: 16. When no signs or signals tell drivers what to do at an intersection:
column4: the first vehicle to enter the intersection has the right-of-way.
column6: drivers on the right must yield to drivers on the left.
column8: drivers turning left must yield to drivers going straight through the intersection.
column10: drivers going straight must yield to drivers turning left at the intersection.

column2: 17. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 18. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: others drive below the speed limit.
column6: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column8: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column10: you are on a four lane road.
